intro: Gouania frangulifolia, commonly known as the silverleaf gouania, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the southeastern United States, particularly Florida and parts of Georgia. The plant is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves that are covered in a fine, silvery down, giving it its common name. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters during the summer months. The plant is often found in moist, sandy soils along streambanks and in wetlands.
